channel.title: Achievements in HL2 and Ep. One
channel.description:
I have whole Orange Box installed, but there is one thing i that does not works.
In Half Life 2 and Episode One there is no "achievements" button in menu, and of course there are no achievements in game. It is weird, because in TF2, Episode Two and Portal it works perfectly. Is there way to turn achievements on?

item.title: Achievements in HL2 and Ep. One
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
CTID:

Too bad the cinematic mod still looks like shit.

I…I felt so lonely…sniff

Cinematic mod’s very subjective. Let me ask you this; did you care deeply about Aztec and Jester when they were killed off in Crysis? High-res textures aren’t always what make the character. Hi-res Alyx, to me, just looks like “some chick with breasts”, not a person.

I think Valve left out HL2/Ep1 achievements so that the console versions get SOMETHING unique after the TF2 fiasco.

item.dc:creator: Kisuke_Moto
item.description:
theriddlen:

Okay, i looked on OverWiki - it says these achievements are for X360 version.

End of topic.

Um nope, Keep looking around. There’s an update I’ve found earlier that gave you updates on the engine and the achievement system as well. I’d show you it but I’ll have to wait until I get home to do that. I’ll place edit to it on this post once it’s there.

Also, you should all get the Half-life 2 cinematic mod 10. It updates Half-life 2 to what it should have looked like before some assholes hacked it. (Replaces textures) The file size to dl the whole thing is about 10GBs. The reason why it’s so big is because it also includes both the episodes. You can dl them individual by parts since they separated knowing it would be a pretty big file.

item.title: Achievements in HL2 and Ep. One
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
They didn’t exist at the time, so no. HL2 and Episode one were both made and released individually before the Orange Box was started, and before achievements were introduced. You’ll also notice that HL2 has no HDR (the option is there, as it’s global for the engine, but it’s not utilized as it didn’t exist at the time HL2 was made.)
